Title: An introduction to AI (...and why you might avoid that term)
Description: This is a non-technical session that explains some of the background to current work in artificial intelligence in health and care.
Prerequsites: NA

Title: Neural nets made ridiculously simple
Description: This is a gentle(ish) introduction to neural nets, which are one of the key technologies used in LLM/ML/AI systems.
Prerequsites: No formal requirements. The session is aimed at those with some previous data experience, and there will be some decorative maths on screen at times. All welcome!??

Title: Version control for beginners
Description: Come to a friendly and informal thematic introduction to version control, and leave knowing that you'll never have to call a file 04_final_really_final.txt ever again. This session is meant for people with no prior version control experience, but will assume that you're pretty code-friendly, and happy to see command-line and other text-based tools in action.
Prerequsites: None

Title: Introduction to Power Automate
Description: A practical introduction to building a first flow in Power Automate. While the session is aimed at people who have never previously used Power Automate, please note that you'll need good digital skills to complete this session as Power Automate isn't especially beginner-friendly.
Prerequsites: Access to Power Automate

Title: Why bother with...Excel?
Description: Aware of Excel, but never been formally introduced? Start here: we'll explain why you might find out more about Excel, and how to start using it to help your work.
Prerequsites: None

Title: Scope of the possible with Excel
Description: A non-technical overview of Excel designed for service leads. Come to find out more about what is possible - and advisable - in Excel, its strengths and weaknesses, and some suggestions for best supporting staff working in Excel
Prerequsites: None

Title: Pivot tables and pivot charts
Description: This is based on our Excel skill-builder session, and is a quick and friendly introduction to pivot tables and charts for those who are already comfortable working in Excel
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas. This session is part of our Excel skills builder course, and is designed to be taken together with the other four sessions in the course. It is not suitable for Excel beginners.

Title: Practical Power Pivot
Description: An introduction to using Power Pivot in Excel. This session is aimed at those with plenty of previous Excel experience, but who are new to Power Pivot
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas.

Title: Relative, absolute, mixed, structured, and R1C1 references in Excel
Description: A review of more advanced methods of referencing and naming in Excel for those with prior experience. Structured referencing, absolute/relative references, the range operator, name management. Based on our Excel Skills course.
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas.

Title: Lambda formulas in Excel
Description: An introduction to lambda formulas in Excel, which are a way of saving and re-using complex formulas simply. Based on our Excel Skills course.
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas.

Title: Lookups in Excel
Description: A review of methods for lookups in Excel.
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas. This session is part of our Excel skills builder course, and is designed to be taken together with the other four sessions in the course. It is not suitable for Excel beginners.

Title: References and names in Excel
Description: Aimed at complete beginners in Excel, this session is all about references and names. All welcome!
Prerequsites: You'll need basic digital skills to complete the session, and you'll need some variety of Excel available to practice. If possible, multiple screens make the training (and everything else on the computer) much easier to manage.

Title: Excel formulas
Description: A gentle interactive introduction to Excel formulas
Prerequsites: You'll need basic digital skills to complete the session, and you'll need some variety of Excel available to practice. If possible, multiple screens make the training (and everything else on the computer) much easier to manage.

Title: Excel first steps
Description: This session is designed as a first introduction to Excel. No prior experience necessary - all welcome to come along and get up and running with Excel. Part of our Excel for Beginner's course.
Prerequsites: You'll need basic digital skills to complete the session, and you'll need some variety of Excel available to practice. If possible, multiple screens make the training (and everything else on the computer) much easier to manage.

Title: Tidy data in Excel
Description: An introduction to shaping data in Excel
Prerequsites: You'll need basic digital skills to complete the session, and you'll need some variety of Excel available to practice. If possible, multiple screens make the training (and everything else on the computer) much easier to manage.

Title: Excel tables
Description: You should probably use tables in Excel. Join this session to find out why
Prerequsites: You'll need basic digital skills to complete the session, and you'll need some variety of Excel available to practice. If possible, multiple screens make the training (and everything else on the computer) much easier to manage.

Title: Excel formatting
Description: This session is a short practical introduction to formatting in Excel. It covers first steps, some sample use-cases, and some considerations around accessibility.
Prerequsites: You'll need basic digital skills to complete the session, and you'll need some variety of Excel available to practice. If possible, multiple screens make the training (and everything else on the computer) much easier to manage.

Title: Logic in Excel
Description: This session introduces a set of tools for working with logic in Excel. We cover a quick introduction to Boolean algebra, introduce a core toolkit of Excel's NOT, AND, and OR functions, then move on to more ambitious formulas and functions for putting logical values to work.
Prerequsites: Excel, ideally M365 Desktop. This is an advanced Excel session that will require users to be comfortable reading and writing Excel formulas.

Title: Why bother with...Power BI?
Description: Aware of Power BI, but never been formally introduced? Start here: we'll explain why you might find out more about Power BI, and how to start using it to help your work.
Prerequsites: None

Title: Scope of the possible with Power BI
Description: A non-technical overview of Power BI designed for service leads. Come to find out more about what is possible - and advisable - in Power BI, its strengths and weaknesses, and some suggestions for best supporting staff working in Power BI
Prerequsites: None

Title: Measures in power BI
Description: A proper intro to writing useful measures in Power BI. Includes an introduction to filter contexts, some basic recipes for common measures, and an introduction to calculate and more advanced Power BI measures.
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop. Comfortable working with Power BI (loading data, basic wrangling, visualisations)

Title: DAX vs Power Query M
Description: Only Microsoft could write a low-code analytics platform that uses two different code-based tools for analytics. This should be a fairly beginner-friendly session looking at the similarities and differences, and making a few suggestions about best applications.
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop. No prior experience of Power BI needed.

Title: BI for beginners (service version, session 1)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI service. This session covers first steps, loading data into Power BI, and first visualizations.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI service. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: BI for beginners (service version, session 2)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI. This session explores the scope of possible visualisations, and runs through building a simple dashboard based on a map.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI service. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: BI for beginners (service version, session 3)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI service. This session covers data wrangling.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI service. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: BI for beginners (service version, session 4)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI service. This session covers using DAX to create measures to display numeric summaries of data.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI service. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: Power Query - a practical introduction
Description: A practical introduction to Power Query as a toolkit for data wrangling
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop and/or Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working with Excel and/or Power BI

Title: R in Power BI
Description: Cross the streams and find out how to use R to add interest (and serious statistical clout) to your dashboards
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop. Comfortable working with Power BI (loading data, basic wrangling, visualisations)

Title: A data-centric introduction to Python
Description: A quick introduction to loading, summarising, and plotting data in Python with frequent R vs Python comparisons
Prerequsites: None. Users wishing to follow along will require a Python 3 environment of some kind.

Title: Why bother with...R?
Description: Aware of R, but never been formally introduced? Start here: we'll explain why you might find out more about R, where you can find sources of support, and how to start using it to help your work in health and care.
Prerequsites: None

Title: Scope of the possible with R
Description: A non-technical overview of R designed for service leads. Come to find out more about what is possible - and advisable - in R, its strengths and weaknesses, and some suggestions for best supporting staff working in R
Prerequsites: None

Title: The scales package
Description: Scales is an exceptionally useful toolbox package for R. This is a bit of general introduction, then a high-speed review of some of the most useful functions
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: We (heart) janitor
Description: After an impromptu love-in at a recent R reading group session, we've decided that the janitor package is the greatest. Join us to find out why
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Rmarkdown crash course
Description: Designed for experienced R users who are new to Rmarkdown
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Plumber / R APIs
Description: A gentle introduction to using APIs in your R projects, and to setting up your own API using Plumber
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Quarto
Description: A conversion course, or a compare-and-contrast session for users of Rmarkdown, something like that.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. Quarto is a bit tricky on some workbench types, so please ensure that you have it installed and available.

Title: Flexdashboard
Description: An introduction to this useful tool for building non-interactive dashboards. Way fewer brackets than Shiny, which is a major selling point from my perspective.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: R project templates
Description: Sick of making src directories by hand? Automate it. This session will cover the basics of making and sharing your own project templates, as well as a few of the quirks and use-cases.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Testing R code
Description: AKA: an introduction to the testthat package, this session will consist of a practical introduction to using tests to troubleshoot R code
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Free text wrangling
Description: tidytext-opinionated introduction to working with free text in R
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: R and dbplyr and dtplyr
Description: This session demonstrates two tools for using tidyverse syntax to produce SQL queries (dbplyr) or to work with data.table (dtplyr)
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Getting more out of dplyr
Description: Based on our existing intermediate R course, this is a session for those with prior dplyr experience to spend some time with the more interesting and advanced functions that it contains.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Writing functions in R
Description: Writing functions is a great way to simplify and re-use code. This is a practical introduction to writing and debugging functions. Based on our existing intermediate R course.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Iteration in R
Description: This is a practical introduction to iterating in R, including discussions about best practices. Based on our existing intermediate R course.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: The purrrr package in R
Description: Find out more about the functional programming tools available in the purrr package. Intended for intermediate R users, and based on our intermediate R session
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Tidyevaluation in R
Description: Find out more about the strengths and weaknesses of the tidyverse approach to programming. Intended for intermediate R users, and based on our intermediate R session
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R.

Title: Parameterised Rmarkdown and Quarto
Description: This short session starts by giving an overview of how parameters can be used to make localised versions of Rmarkdown/Quarto documents. We'll then look at some example use-cases in health, social care, and housing, and finish with some top tips and suggestions.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R and Rmarkdown/Quarto.

Title: Styling Word docs with Rmarkdown
Description: This short training session is designed for existing Rmarkdown users, specifically for people looking to improve the styling of .docx output.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R and Rmarkdown. Microsoft Word.

Title: Getting the best out of openxlsx
Description: openxlsx gives users many powerful ways of reading and writing Excel files from R, but it can be quirky. Join this recipe-based session to pick up some helpful tips for reading and producing Excel workbooks.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R and Rmarkdown. Microsoft Excel.

Title: Styling Shiny with bslib
Description: This is an introduction to styling Shiny dashboards with bslib
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R and Shiny.

Title: Dates and times with lubridate.
Description: Great package, awful name. Come along for a beginner's introduction to working with dates and times with lubridate
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. You should also be fairly comfortable working in R.

Title: Intro to predictive models in R
Description: This is a from-scratch introduction to predictive modelling for R users
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Basic R experience

Title: R projects
Description: You should probably be using projects to organise your R code. Join this session to find out why, and how, to do that.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Basic R experience

Title: R from scratch (session 1)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R (from our introductory R course). This session covers basic R building blocks - functions, variables, brackets, and the pipe.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: dplyr from scratch
Description: A from-scratch introduction to manipulating data in R with dplyr (from our introductory R course)
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Basic R experience - e.g. from R from scratch session

Title: ggplot from scratch
Description: A from-scratch introduction to graph drawing in R with ggplot2 (from our introductory R course)
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Basic R experience - e.g. from R from scratch session

Title: R from scratch (session 2)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R (from our introductory R course). This session covers tibbles, and how you might read data in from file to create them.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: R from scratch (session 3)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R (from our introductory R course). This session covers a basic introduction to the dplyr package for working with tibbles.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: R from scratch (session 4)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R (from our introductory R course). This session covers useful non-tibble data structures, especially vectors and lists.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: R from scratch (session 5)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R (from our introductory R course). This session covers a brief introduction to plotting with the ggplot2 package.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: R from scratch (session 6)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R (from our introductory R course). This session covers tips and tricks for making your life easier in R, including debugging, writing easy-to-maintain code, and writing basic functions.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: Debugging R
Description: This session introduces a range of strategies for dealing with broken R code
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. The session is aimed at R beginners.

Title: Hacker Stats (AKA Resampling Methods)
Description: Hacker Stats (AKA Resampling Methods): Three Weird Tricks for addressing almost all your hypothesis testing needs. Led by PHS's Jonathan Minton, this session is an introduction to resampling in R. You can find helpful session materials on Jonathan's blog at https://jonminton.github.io/jon-blog/glms.html#resampling-methodshacker-stats
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. General competence in R programming, and broad familiarity with statistical hypothesis testing. You might also find it helpful to have access to some coloured index cards or Post-it notes

Title: sequential networks in keras
Description: Practical introduction based on the MNIST set
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Keras package installed, which is non-trivially complicated.

Title: Shiny modules
Description: NA
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. Basic familiarity with Shiny needed - e.g. from Shiny from Scratch session.

Title: Shiny from scratch
Description: A from-scratch introduction to Shiny for the R-experienced (from our introductory Shiny course)
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. No Shiny experience needed.

Title: Shiny inputs
Description: A review of basic methods for capturing input in Shiny (from our introductory Shiny course). Assumes good working knowledge of R, and basic familiarity with Shiny.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. Basic familiarity with Shiny needed - e.g. from Shiny from Scratch session.

Title: Understanding reactivity
Description: Shiny is reactive, which apparently means something to some people. Come along to understand the big difference between R and Shiny, and hopefully leave understanding why you can't read a Shiny script from top-to-bottom and expect to understand it. From our introductory Shiny course. Assumes good working knowledge of R, and basic familiarity with Shiny.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. Basic familiarity with Shiny needed - e.g. from Shiny from Scratch session.

Title: Effective writing tips and tricks
Description: This is a quick introduction to writing the great American novel effective prose for the analytically-minded.
Prerequsites: Prior experience writing for technical or professional purposes.

Title: Referencing
Description: A platform-agnostic guide to the how and why of referencing
Prerequsites: Experience writing professionally, and some experience of the academic literature (for example, you'd know what a journal article was)

Title: Leading a training session
Description: Tips and tricks for delivering training (and claiming appropriate credit for so doing)
Prerequsites: Interest? Enthusiasm? Need?

Title: Types of reasoning
Description: This is a conceptual session that introduces some of the main qualitative ideas about reasoning. Join us to find out why not all swans are white, why the past is an unreliable guide to the future, and why we might not be entirely certain what knowledge is.
Prerequsites: None

Title: HTML for non-web developers
Description: A crash-course in HTML for those who aren't actually planning to use it to write their own website.
Prerequsites: None

Title: CSS and Javascript for non-web developers
Description: Find out why the NASA website got 10x longer over 25 years, and learn to style web stuff
Prerequsites: None

Title: Presenting
Description: An introduction to presenting work in public
Prerequsites: This session is aimed at those new to presenting, or who are nervous about presenting, or who would like to improve their presentation skills, but don't know where to start. No prerequisites, although you will need a mic (and ideally camera) to do the practice presentation during the session.

Title: Tableau for beginners (session 1)
Description: Based on our BI for Beginner's course, this is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Tableau public. This session covers first steps, loading data into Tableau, and first visualizations.
Prerequsites: Access to Tableau Public. No previous Tableau experience needed.

Title: Tableau for beginners (session 2)
Description: Based on our BI for Beginner's course, this is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Tableau public. This session explores the scope of possible visualisations in Tableau
Prerequsites: Access to Tableau Public. No previous Tableau experience needed.

Title: Tableau for beginners (session 3)
Description: Based on our BI for Beginner's course, this is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Tableau public. This session covers data wrangling. Note that this session uses Excel and Power Query to avoid some of the limitations of Tableau Public.
Prerequsites: Access to Tableau Public. Excel, ideally M365 Desktop. No previous Tableau experience needed.

Title: Tableau for beginners (session 4)
Description: Based on our BI for Beginner's course, this is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Tableau public. This session covers summarising and communicating summaries of data.
Prerequsites: Access to Tableau Public. No previous Tableau experience needed.

Title: Flowcharts in Mermaid
Description: This is a quick and friendly introduction to using Mermaid.JS to produce flowcharts. It's specifically aimed at people who haven't written code before.
Prerequsites: Access to [mermaid.live](https://mermaid.live)

Title: Conditions in Power Automate
Description: This session shows you how to build Power Automate flows based on conditional logic
Prerequsites: Access to Power Automate, and prior basic experience of using it.

Title: Introductory Shiny (session 1)
Description: This is a session from our beginner's Shiny course. It's aimed at analysts working in health, care, and housing, and gives a full introduction to Shiny dashboards in R.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. If you're new to R, we would suggest enrolling on our Introductory R and Rmarkdown course before undertaking this Shiny training. You should plan to attend each of the five sessions.

Title: Introductory Shiny (session 2)
Description: This is a session from our beginner's Shiny course. It's aimed at analysts working in health, care, and housing, and gives a full introduction to Shiny dashboards in R.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. If you're new to R, we would suggest enrolling on our Introductory R and Rmarkdown course before undertaking this Shiny training. You should plan to attend each of the five sessions.

Title: Introductory Shiny (session 3)
Description: This is a session from our beginner's Shiny course. It's aimed at analysts working in health, care, and housing, and gives a full introduction to Shiny dashboards in R.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. If you're new to R, we would suggest enrolling on our Introductory R and Rmarkdown course before undertaking this Shiny training. You should plan to attend each of the five sessions.

Title: Introductory Shiny (session 4)
Description: This is a session from our beginner's Shiny course. It's aimed at analysts working in health, care, and housing, and gives a full introduction to Shiny dashboards in R.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. If you're new to R, we would suggest enrolling on our Introductory R and Rmarkdown course before undertaking this Shiny training. You should plan to attend each of the five sessions.

Title: Introductory Shiny (session 5)
Description: This is a session from our beginner's Shiny course. It's aimed at analysts working in health, care, and housing, and gives a full introduction to Shiny dashboards in R.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Comfortable working in R. If you're new to R, we would suggest enrolling on our Introductory R and Rmarkdown course before undertaking this Shiny training. You should plan to attend each of the five sessions.

Title: BI for beginners (session 1)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI. This session covers first steps, loading data into Power BI, and first visualizations.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI desktop. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: BI for beginners (session 2)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI. This session explores the scope of possible visualisations, and runs through building a simple dashboard based on a map.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI desktop. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: BI for beginners (session 3)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI. This session covers data wrangling using Power Query.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI desktop. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: BI for beginners (session 4)
Description: This is a beginner-friendly and self-contained introduction to Power BI. This session covers using DAX to create measures to display numeric summaries of data.
Prerequsites: Access to Power BI desktop. No previous Power BI experience necessary.

Title: Excel foundations 1
Description: This session covers a thorough review of Excel basics for those with substantial prior experience of Excel, including references, tables, ranges, and values
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas. This session is part of our Excel skills builder course, and is designed to be taken together with the other four sessions in the course. It is not suitable for Excel beginners.

Title: Excel foundations 2
Description: This session covers a thorough review of Excel formulas for those with substantial prior experience of Excel
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas. This session is part of our Excel skills builder course, and is designed to be taken together with the other four sessions in the course. It is not suitable for Excel beginners.

Title: Excel programming
Description: This session is an introduction to programming in Excel, including implicit intersection and naming, R1C1 referencing, the INDIRECT() function, array formulas, and lambda function
Prerequsites: Excel M365 Desktop. Comfortable working in Excel, and familiar with tables, references, formulas. This session is part of our Excel skills builder course, and is designed to be taken together with the other four sessions in the course. It is not suitable for Excel beginners.

Title: Intermediate Power BI (session 1)
Description: This session is part of our intermediate-level Power BI desktop training course
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop, prior experience working in Power BI

Title: Intermediate Power BI (session 2)
Description: This session is part of our intermediate-level Power BI desktop training course
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop, prior experience working in Power BI

Title: Intermediate Power BI (session 3)
Description: This session is part of our intermediate-level Power BI desktop training course
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop, prior experience working in Power BI

Title: Intermediate Power BI (session 4)
Description: This session is part of our intermediate-level Power BI desktop training course
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop, prior experience working in Power BI

Title: Intermediate Power BI (session 5)
Description: This session is part of our intermediate-level Power BI desktop training course
Prerequsites: Power BI Desktop, prior experience working in Power BI

Title: Intermediate Shiny (session 1)
Description: tba - this is a pilot session for our new intermediate Shiny course, and will probably be about Shiny modules
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Good general R skills, and prior experience of working in Shiny.

Title: Intermediate Shiny (session 2)
Description: tba - this is a pilot session for our new intermediate Shiny course, and will probably be about theming with bslib
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Good general R skills, and prior experience of working in Shiny.

Title: Mailing lists in Power Automate
Description: An introductory session showing how to build simple Excel- and Sharepoint Lists-based mailing lists using Power Automate
Prerequsites: Access to Power Automate at https://www.powerautomate.com. You'll also need to be able to access at least one of OneDrive/Sharepoint Lists, and would ideally have some basic prior experience of working with Power Automate.

Title: Build a package in R
Description: An intermediate-ish session about writing your own R package, based on chapter 1 of the R packages book - https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html. This is an unusual session for us, because there's a price to pay: you'll need to send me (at brendan.clarke2@nhs.scot) a chunk of R code that you'd like to turn into a package. It 100% doesn't need to be fancy, but it does need to include at least one function that we can use to try out the training session. Please make sure you email that through in advance of the session.
Prerequsites: Rstudio with R > 4 or Posit.Cloud access or Posit Workbench access. Good general R skills, and prior experience of working in Shiny. Working code that you'd like to reproduce.

Title: Scope of the possible with Power Automate
Description: This is a non-technical session introducing Power Automate, explaining how it works, and showing some examples of possible uses in health and care. All welcome, especially if you've never used Power Automate before.
Prerequsites: None. Note that Power Automate isn't entirely beginner-friendly, so this session is mainly aimed at people with a good level of digital skills.

Title: An introduction to R and Rmarkdown (session 1)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R and Rmarkdown. This session covers setting up posit.cloud, and writing basic Rmarkdown
Prerequsites: posit.cloud access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: An introduction to R and Rmarkdown (session 2)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R and Rmarkdown. This session covers a basic introduction to R
Prerequsites: posit.cloud access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: An introduction to R and Rmarkdown (session 3)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R and Rmarkdown. This session covers a simple introduction to working with tabular data in dplyr
Prerequsites: posit.cloud access. No previous R experience needed.

Title: An introduction to R and Rmarkdown (session 4)
Description: A from-scratch introduction to R and Rmarkdown. This session covers using ggplot2 to produce plots, and a basic introduction to integrating them into Rmarkdown
Prerequsites: posit.cloud access. No previous R experience needed.
